What is it that bodhisattvas cause all sentient beings to give rise to joy?

Just as when the moon first appears, all sentient beings become cool and refreshed, and because of the pleasant feeling, they all give rise to joy, so too is the moon of the bodhisattva. When it first appears, all sentient beings are able to completely abandon the burning afflictions and give rise to joy and happiness. This is called the bodhisattva causing all sentient beings to give rise to joy.
What is meant by the bodhisattva being one whom the multitude delights to see?

Just as when the moon first appears, all sentient beings delight in beholding it, so-called because it is good, wonderful, pure, and white, causing the minds of all sentient beings to give rise to joy.

The moon of the bodhisattva is also like this. When it first appears, all sentient beings love and delight in it, so-called because the seeds of the pure faculties are pure and white, and in all practices, they are fully endowed with deportment. This is called the bodhisattva being one whom the multitude delights to see.
What is meant by the bodhisattva's wholesome qualities increasing?
It is like the waxing moon, which increases day by day from the first day of the lunar month until the fifteenth day when the moon is full and all its aspects are complete.

The moon of the bodhisattva is also like this. From the initial generation of the mind of enlightenment up to sitting at the site of enlightenment, the wholesome dharmas gradually increase day by day. When sitting at the site of enlightenment, all the excellent characteristics are completely fulfilled. This is the bodhisattvas' increase in wholesome dharmas.
What is the bodhisattvas' decrease in unwholesome dharmas?
It is like when the dark fortnight arrives, the orb of the moon gradually decreases in brightness, and as it decreases, on the last day of the month it completely disappears.

The moon of the bodhisattva is also like this. When it reaches the time of possessing supramundane wisdom, unwholesome dharmas gradually decrease. As they decrease, up to sitting at the site of enlightenment, they are completely extinguished without any remainder. This is the bodhisattvas' decrease in unwholesome dharmas.

What is the bodhisattva's pure bodily form?

Just as the bodily form of the moon-god is pure, clean, and unstained, because it is accomplished through superior karmic retribution, so too is the bodhisattva's bodily form. It is originally unstained, accomplished through purity, born through pure transformation, not born from the impurities of parents, semen, blood, and so forth. This is the bodhisattva's pure bodily form.
What is the bodhisattva's riding the supreme vehicle?

Just as the moon god rides a pure vehicle to illuminate the four continents, the moon of the bodhisattva is also like this, riding the supreme vehicle of the bodhisattva to widely illuminate the boundless worlds of all directions. This is the bodhisattva riding the supreme vehicle.
What is meant by the bodhisattva always adorning himself?

Just as the original appearance of the moon god is pure and always adorns himself, not because of bathing, the moon of the bodhisattva is also like this, always adorning himself with supreme merits and virtues. This is the bodhisattva always adorning himself.
What is meant by the bodhisattva playing in the joy of the Dharma?

Just as the moon god always enjoys heavenly bliss, the moon of the bodhisattva is also like this, always playing in the supreme and wonderful joy of the Dharma, unstained by the desires and objects of the world. This is the bodhisattva playing in the joy of the Dharma.
What is meant by the bodhisattva possessing great spiritual powers and majestic virtue?

Just as the moon god possesses great spiritual powers and majestic virtue, illuminating everything, the moon of the bodhisattva is also like this. Because it is endowed with great blessings, wisdom, and supreme merits, this is the bodhisattva's possession of great spiritual powers and majestic virtue.
